data.title: Intellisense suggestions should display an horizontal scrollbar if needed

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install java extension
2. open java file
3. type `import o`, wait for suggestions to show up
suggestions are truncated because the package names don't fit in the suggestion window, there's no way to scroll horizontally

See https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/249
[![https://gyazo.com/9f0b536a9f71d72a4939ffbb4834340d](https://i.gyazo.com/9f0b536a9f71d72a4939ffbb4834340d.png)](https://gyazo.com/9f0b536a9f71d72a4939ffbb4834340d)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Maybe

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launched NVDA on Windows (10) yesterday afternoon
2. Ever since that moment, the screen reader notification is permanently on the bottom bar, even after quitting the screen reader and restarting my PC several times
3. In addition, my issues with lines not wrapping and the mini-map disappearing (which I only just noticed) seem to be related to this. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14346320/27638012-a4f5b6ce-5c09-11e7-95ea-a503a214d647.png)

data.title: MarkedString cannot link to virtual documents anymore
data.body: Since we now only allow for certain schemes in links that come from markdown we have broken links to virtual documents. I don't think that is necessary or a security risk: `!href.match(/^http:|https:|file:|mailto:|command:/i)`. This is related to https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29076.

data.title: Integrated terminal default key does not match documentation
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:21:47.485Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install a fresh copy of visual studio code
2. Press control + backtick (`) on your keyboard, the integrated terminal will not open.

The documentation states that this is what it is:
https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/integrated-terminal


It also used to be this on previous builds, however has been now mapped to ctrl + ' .

data.title: Debug Typescript Not Stopping on Break Points - Electron
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro
- Node7.4.0

I am attempting to debug an electron app written in Typescript and compiled to JS/sourcemaps with gulp and debugged with VSCode.  The electron instance is launched, the debugger is attached and it appears to be able to resolve the typescript source using the source maps but the debugger never stops.  It doesn't even stop if I put a `debugger;` statement in the Typesrcipt.

I can supply more information if required, here are a few bits that seem relevant but don't mean much to me.  Any help much appreciated.

Here are the relevant bits of the launch file:
```json
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node",
            "request": "launch",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}/source/server/main.ts",
            "outFiles": [
                "${workspaceRoot}/dist/server/src/main.js",
                "${workspaceRoot}/dist/server/**/*.js"
            ],
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "trace": "all",
            "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron",
            "windows": {
                "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd"
            },
            "runtimeArgs": [
                ".",
                "--enable-logging"
            ],
            "sourceMaps": true
        }
    ]
}
```

Here is the output from the debug console:
```
23708: _findSourceMapUrl: source map url found at end of generated file 'c:/code/GIT/project/test_harness_gui/dist/server/src/main.js'

23708: _registerSourceMap: c:/code/git/project/test_harness_gui/source/server/harnessinstance.ts -> c:/code/git/project/test_harness_gui/dist/server/src/harnessinstance.js
23708: _registerSourceMap: c:/code/git/project/test_harness_gui/source/server/harnessserver.ts -> c:/code/git/project/test_harness_gui/dist/server/src/harnessserver.js
23708: launchRequest: program 'c:\code\GIT\project\test_harness_gui\source\server\main.ts' seems to be the source; launch the generated file 'c:\code\GIT\project\test_harness_gui\dist\server\src\main.js' instead
c:\code\GIT\project\test_harness_gui/node_modules/.bin/electron.cmd --debug-brk=42194 . --enable-logging dist\server\src\main.js 
23708: _attach: address: 127.0.0.1 port: 42194

23708: _attach: connected
23708: __initialize: got process id 2696 from node
```

data.body: We should sent a telemetry event if a task gets configured.

data.title: Use + and - as aria labels in the diff review panel
data.body:
Extracted from https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29496#issuecomment-311556170

* what is currently read out as "unchanged" should be a no-op
* what is currently read out as "inserted" should be "+"
* what is currently read out as "deleted" should be "-"

data.title: Not existing multi root folder should not show an error
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29176

Having a root that does not exist should not show an error imho. Better would be to maybe gray out that folder to indicate it is not on disk.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/900690/27632602-6b144c02-5bfc-11e7-9e70-345c56a2172c.png)

data.title: Copy on multi root folder is a no-op
data.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29176

The copy action on a root folder does not seem to do anything. Maybe we should disable it.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Write a link in a file, such as `E:\XXX` in `ReadME.md`:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12682063/27630498-3bb28f10-5c28-11e7-9f04-b3d3da418882.png)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Prelaunch task does not terminate
data.body:
testing #29447

Created an extension and upgraded the task.json to version 2.0.
After doing that the debugger waits for ever until the preLaunch task terminates.
When I terminate the task manually, then the target extension is launched properly.

When I change the compile script in package.json to not be watching, then the extension target launches correctly.

```
        "compile": "tsc -p ./",
```

my changes to the tasks.json

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27631907-72f8f154-5bfa-11e7-99f0-697590496321.png)

tasks.json
```
{
    "version": "2.0.0",

    // we want to run npm
    "command": "npm",

    // the command is a shell script
    "type": "shell",
    
    // show the output window only if unrecognized errors occur.
    "showOutput": "silent",

    // we run the custom script "compile" as defined in package.json
    "args": ["run", "compile", "--loglevel", "silent"],

    // The tsc compiler is started in watching mode
    "isBackground": true,

    // use the standard tsc in watch mode problem matcher to find compile problems in the output.
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
}
```

Actually the preLaunch task does terminate as is shown in the console:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/172399/27630996-76366cbe-5bf7-11e7-8474-7370230c4b5c.png)

data.title: Spelling errors (diagnostics) prevent debugging
data.body:
When debugging, if there are errors (diagnostics), vscode will say

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7588612/27628964-476add9e-5c23-11e7-83a2-3340dea4e1f9.png)

The problem is that, most of the spell check extensions will show spell errors as diagnostics in the Problems panel

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7588612/27629298-78436a98-5c24-11e7-80bb-95e89a0eb97f.png)

But these 'spelling errors' are not 'build errors'. It's not good to have one more `debug anyway` click just because those 'spelling errors'.

data.title: Switch to the less invasive update UI and add an update reminder
data.body:
We should push the update UI we were running on insiders to stable. 

Since the new update notification UI is less invasive, there is the concern that users might forget to update and ignore the notification. Therefore we should add an update reminder, when a user did not update after a period of time. The proposal is to show the existing Update Available message box, when the user did not update after 5 days since the notification has appeared.
